author: wrowe
msg: Get Win32 building again.  Doesn't build clean, but at least it builds.
poll on win32 may or may not work correctly, but then again, I don't
believe that httpd needs it at this moment.  Not blasting win32's poll
until coders are done with it.

author: rbb
msg: An attempt at the OS/2 implementation.  I have no OS/2 box, so this
probably won't work, but at least it is a start.  My only question is can
you select on a file descriptor on OS/2?  If not, then we will just have
to return an error on OS/2 if somebody tries to.

author: rbb
msg: Remove the old BeOS poll implementation.  BeOS's poll implementation looks
like the select implementation on Unix, so I believe that this should just

author: rbb
msg: Reimplement apr_poll() on Unix.  This improves performance by giving the
user back control over the memory in the pollset.
